AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.synopsis: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.

OpposedFaithwarden.synopsis: You defeat Kagha in the denouncement scene: Rath approaches you (if he is alive) and provides you with access to a powerful sceptre and an honorary title: 'faithwarden'.

SnakesCourt.synopsis: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.

PAD_KidDied.synopsis: Reaction after Arabella, a tiefling child, is killed by the druid Kagha's serpent in the grove. Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who was in the dialog and had opportunity to stop it. (May have tried and failed or simply refrained from acting)Speaker 2 is an accompanying character, they may have an opinionated line regarding the outcome according to their own beliefs.

Denouncing.synopsis: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.synopsis: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.synopsis: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.

001.synopsis: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.

LeaderPersuaded.synopsis: You revealed Kagha to be a Shadow Druid, but convinced her to stand against them. She now contemplates what has happened, repentant and ready to stand trial for her crimes.
LeaderPersuaded.how_to_trigger: - start a new game as a druid- oe denouncingkaghadone 1- talk to Kagha (S_DEN_DruidLeader)

AD_ShadowDruid_001_TakingTurn_Combat.synopsis: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.

AD_SnakesCourt.synopsis: Court is in session. A tiefling child has stolen an artifact from the druids. Kagha the head druid wishes to imprison the child to set an example to the others. Rath thinks this is taking it too far.

SelfReflection.synopsis: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.

Opposed.synopsis: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.

AD_CallWolf.synopsis: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.synopsis: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.

LeaderSaved.synopsis: Kagha's dialog after the Celebration (post-AttackOnDen or post-GoblinHunt), if the scene with the parents occured and the player saved her.CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_Event_SavedKagha = true
LeaderSaved.how_to_trigger: goto 205 406oe denraiddonewalk inside the grove to the middle of the caveoe snakecourtdoneoe killgobleadersgoto 211 456talk to Zevlor (he's up the ladder there)go to camp, after the camp intro you can see that a bunch of tieflings are theregoto -629 -161 (that's a position in the camp, where Kagha + the parents are)If parents aren't visible (previous bug) use:setOnstage S_DEN_ParentAsetOnstage S_DEN_ParentBTalk to one of the parents. Use shift+Q or roll amazing to make sure you succeed your persuasion and save Kagha. You can skip through the dialogNow Kagha has the dialog DEN_ShadowDruid_LeaderSaved

AD_OpposedPacified.synopsis: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together

003.synopsis: Shadow druid in rat shape. Will not speak if you have speak with animals active.
003.how_to_trigger: goto -468, -44, speak with kaghafinish dialogueoe debugbook > misc cheats and settings > tags > class tags > Add tag DRUID

002.synopsis: A shadow Druid in rat form. Using speak with animals doesn't result in anything useful.
002.how_to_trigger: from crashsite:in reCon: teleport S_DEN_ShadowDruid_002skip through dialogue w/ kagha (do nothing choices)Click on rat Pinta

Leader.synopsis: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
Leader.how_to_trigger: in reCon: teleport S_DEN_DruidLeaderplay through first dialogue (SnakesCourt). Your choices in that dialogue affect different paths in this oneclick on Kagha after to trigger this dialogue

LeaderPostGoblins.synopsis: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

AD_OpposedDenounce.synopsis: Player persuaded Kagha to not join the shadow druids after all. Kagha and Rath survived the combat and are talking together now. Kagha is good, repentant.

AD_KaghaInCombat.synopsis: Kagha has been outed and is now fighting the players with the Shadow Druids.

KidFreed.synopsis: |Arabella (Snake Kid) after she ran away from the druid lair.|
KidFreed.how_to_trigger: from crashsitein reCon: teleport S_DEN_DruidLeaderplay through first dialogue (SnakesCourt) Roll amazing to free the child on any persuasion check Arabella will run awayteleport S_DEN_SnakeKidclick on Arabella and skip through dialogue with parentsclick on Arabella again to trigger this dialogue

AD_LeaderPersuaded.synopsis: Plays ONLY if Rath died in the combat against the Shadow Druids! If Rath is alive, He and Kagha have an AD together instead. In all cases, Kagha is mourning, shocked and repentant at what she has done.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

OpposedFaithwarden_1.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_1.text: I pray the Treefather nourishes Kagha's wounded soul, now that she is dead.

OpposedFaithwarden_0.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_0.text: When Kagha shirked her duty, you upheld it in her stead. Let this gift be our thanks.

OpposedFaithwarden_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha produces a magical staff and gives to the player.

OpposedFaithwarden_2.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_2.text: You burn like fire, you howl like wind. You are Faithwarden.

OpposedFaithwarden_3.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_3.text: A Faithwarden speaks with the authority of the four elements. When you speak, the circles will listen.

OpposedFaithwarden_6.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_6.text: Go forth, and let your might be known.

OpposedFaithwarden_4.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_4.text: You have saved Kagha from herself. I cannot thank you enough.
OpposedFaithwarden_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Kagha renounced her ways, she is alive, but script failed to make her start the dialog and it is falling back on Rath.

OpposedFaithwarden_5.speaker: Rath
OpposedFaithwarden_5.text: A tragedy, that Kagha would turn her back on shadow, only to succumb to it.

SnakesCourt_182.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_182.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt_237.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_237.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt_45.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_45.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt_76.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_76.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

SnakesCourt_79.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_79.text: *A death viper. You have milked their poison before. A single drop of it could kill that child in a heartbeat.*

SnakesCourt_143.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_143.text: Thief? Poison? What's this girl's actual crime?

SnakesCourt_31.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_31.text: She eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!

SnakesCourt_209.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_209.text: Imprison her? She's just a child.

SnakesCourt_88.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_88.text: Tell me, Blade. Is the healer cruel for ridding the sick of disease?

SnakesCourt_53.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_53.text: She's not a disease - she's a child.

SnakesCourt_220.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_220.text: They are a blight, each and all. If I cannot choke it out, I will burn it away.

SnakesCourt_65.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_65.text: You're no healer. And you're no judge either. Let her go.

SnakesCourt_214.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_214.text: The blight must be cut away for healing to begin. First, the spawn. The rest will follow.

SnakesCourt_157.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_157.text: This isn't my kind of justice... but I won't stand in your way.

SnakesCourt_138.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_138.text: One of your guards outside said you wanted to see me. Here I am.

SnakesCourt_183.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_183.text: We will speak soon enough. First, judgement must be passed.

SnakesCourt_10.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_10.text: The parasite eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!

SnakesCourt_5.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_5.text: Rath - lock her up. She remains here until the rite is complete.

SnakesCourt_75.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_75.text: And keep still, devil. Teela is restless.

SnakesCourt_236.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_236.text: Come, Kagha. We took back the idol. Surely...

SnakesCourt_131.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_131.text: *The death of a child. A timeless tragedy that never grows old.*
SnakesCourt_131.context: NodeContext: Dark urge getting excited about the prospect of killing a child

SnakesCourt_13.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_13.text: Flick your eyes to the exit so the child will try to run.

SnakesCourt_81.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_81.text: Your mind wants the snake to kill the child. But your heart doesn't. Snap out of it.

SnakesCourt_48.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_48.text: *Her life matters more than satiating your dark fantasies. You focus and they're gone. But clearly, this child's life is in danger.*

SnakesCourt_139.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_139.text: You've proven your authority. Now prove your mercy.

SnakesCourt_234.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_234.text: Fair words. Child, take to the others word of my grace. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
SnakesCourt_234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

SnakesCourt_30.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_30.text: Free the whelp, or I run your belly through with a blade.

SnakesCourt_187.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_187.text: The girl is no threat. Jailing her disrupts nature's balance.

SnakesCourt_153.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_153.text: Don't druids cherish harmony? Jailing the girl disrupts nature's balance.

SnakesCourt_105.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_105.text: Don't druids cherish harmony? Jailing the girl disrupts nature's balance.

SnakesCourt_242.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_242.text: I hear the Treefather's spirit in your words.

SnakesCourt_100.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_100.text: The devil sowed chaos. She remains until the rite is complete!

SnakesCourt_229.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_229.text: *The snake's hiss of approval reveals its intentions. Should the child struggle, it is poised to strike.*
SnakesCourt_229.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

SnakesCourt_66.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_66.text: Your snake is prepared to kill this child. Do you want her death on your hands?

SnakesCourt_160.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera looks to snake and it hisses menacingly.

SnakesCourt_115.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_115.text: Imprisoning her empowers the refugees. Are you willing to risk insurrection?

SnakesCourt_113.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_113.text: Call off your snake or it goes in my dinner pot tonight.

SnakesCourt_106.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_106.text: You dare speak of Teela in this manner?

SnakesCourt_111.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_111.text: Let the child go, so she can spread word to the others of your might.

SnakesCourt_235.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_235.text: Yes. She is more valuable out there than in here. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
SnakesCourt_235.context: NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

SnakesCourt_141.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: After Kagha's line, |Rath tries to grab the child, but the child breaks away, and the snakes lunge for her. She collapses on the spot; Rath runs to her in a panic.|

SnakesCourt_180.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Rath tries to revive the child, but with no success.|

SnakesCourt_2.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: After the line, we see Sagha rubbing her head and considering what to do. This should be a nice long pause. Then she becomes EVIL for good.NodeContext: AY-thyas. Draconian language for SHIT!

SnakesCourt_121.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_121.text: Gone. By the gods, Kagha, what have you done?
SnakesCourt_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Rath looks to Kagha, appalled by what has happened.

SnakesCourt_190.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_190.text: Bury the remains. Continue the rite.

SnakesCourt_114.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_114.text: And the parents? They're just outside...

SnakesCourt_161.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_161.text: This outsider will take word once I've spoken to them. We must focus on the rite.

SnakesCourt_117.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_117.text: *The corpse is frozen in her final moment of agony. Well, at least you tried.*

SnakesCourt_169.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_169.text: Let the child go, so she can spread word to the others of your might.

SnakesCourt_58.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_58.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.

SnakesCourt_162.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_162.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.

SnakesCourt_197.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_197.text: Release her. I'll see that she stays out of trouble.

SnakesCourt_21.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_21.text: Very well - she may go. Break your word, and my serpent shall feed. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
SnakesCourt_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Says first line to you, then speaks to the serpent.NodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

SnakesCourt_15.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_15.text: No - the tiefling remains until the rite is complete.

SnakesCourt_130.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_130.text: A seed nobly sown renders the sweetest fruit. Be noble - set her free.

SnakesCourt_36.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_36.text: A seed nobly sown renders the sweetest fruit. Be noble - set her free.

SnakesCourt_9.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_9.text: The words of the Treefather, spoken plain.

SnakesCourt_221.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_221.text: It is as you say. Ssifisv - Teela, to me.
SnakesCourt_221.context: CinematicNodeContext: First line to player, Second to snake. The snake then slithers to the side of KaghaNodeContext: A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

SnakesCourt_134.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_134.text: Out, thief. My grace has its limits.

SnakesCourt_110.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_110.text: *Is Lady Shar punishing you? Or perhaps testing you? Is it the tadpole, or a curse? You cannot say.*
SnakesCourt_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

SnakesCourt_227.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_227.text: Silently petition Lady Shar for guidance.

SnakesCourt_109.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

SnakesCourt_59.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_59.text: It was nothing. Put it out of your mind.

SnakesCourt_11.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_11.text: *But was it truly nothing?  The pain gripped you tight, robbing you of all composure for a moment...*
SnakesCourt_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Default pose/Shadowheart no longer being affected by the pain of the incurable wound.

SnakesCourt_199.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_199.text: *A hot spike of pain overcomes you, and a strange image is thrust upon your mind's eye. You are a frightened little girl, in a dark chamber. A hooded figure approaches, brandishing a rod...*
SnakesCourt_199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.InternalNodeContext: Incurable wound imagery/memory fragment - SH recalls being punished and  chastisted in the Sharran Grotto.

SnakesCourt_46.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

SnakesCourt_205.speaker: Shadowheart
SnakesCourt_205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

SnakesCourt_34.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt_34.text: Thank you, Kagha. Master Halsin would...

SnakesCourt_219.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_219.text: Halsin isn't here. Keep his name off your tongue, lest Teela pierce it.

SnakesCourt_137.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_137.text: I've heard enough. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

SnakesCourt_99.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_99.text: I am versed in the ways of justice. Make your case, and I will pass judgement.

SnakesCourt_57.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_57.text: Very well. I'll defer to your ruling.

SnakesCourt_16.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_16.text: My circle has offered grace to these outsiders. We gave them shelter from storm, we nourished their bellies.

SnakesCourt_78.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_78.text: In return, these devils lured in a horde of goblins, and their spawn stole the one relic that might keep us safe.

SnakesCourt_47.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_47.text: We've taken back our relic. But I will keep the fiend caged 'til our protection rite is complete.

SnakesCourt_193.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_193.text: What do you have to say for yourself, child?

SnakesCourt_93.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_93.text: I am ready to pass judgement.

SnakesCourt_25.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_25.text: I - I was scared. They said when the rite was over, we'd have to leave.

SnakesCourt_152.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_152.text: But there's goblins out there, and worse. And it's nice here, so I - I took the idol. I thought maybe then we could stay.

SnakesCourt_83.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_83.text: Please, let me go. I'll be good, I swear.

SnakesCourt_60.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_60.text: Justice means nothing without mercy. Let her go.

SnakesCourt_35.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_35.text: Thank you thank you thank you!

SnakesCourt_136.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_136.text: Return the girl to her family. She's made amends, and you have your relic.

SnakesCourt_18.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_18.text: Cage the girl. It's a fitting response to the crime she committed.

SnakesCourt_247.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt_247.context: NodeContext: About to be put in a cage, scared out of her mind

SnakesCourt_129.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_129.text: Unfortunate, but temporary. Detain her for only as long as necessary.

SnakesCourt_149.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_149.text: This isn't justice, this is cruelty. Let the child go.

SnakesCourt_181.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_181.text: The girl has made her amends. Return her to her family.

SnakesCourt_29.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_29.text: Imprisonment is an appropriate punishment for theft. Lock her up.

SnakesCourt_102.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_102.text: Unfortunate, but temporary. Detain her for only as long as necessary.

SnakesCourt_142.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_142.text: I did not ask for counsel. The devil remains until the rite is complete!

SnakesCourt_0.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_0.text: You act rashly - as a cornered viper would. Free the child or more tieflings will interrupt you.

SnakesCourt_52.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_52.text: Tsk. A gathered herd of the devils would indeed be disruptive.

SnakesCourt_171.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_171.text: Silvanus was more concerned with 'nobly sown seeds' than punishing children, was He not?

SnakesCourt_144.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: She shrinks back slightly in the face of such unexpected furyNodeContext: Cowed but trying not to show/sound it

SnakesCourt_39.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: To the snake, who then slithers to the side of Kagha

SnakesCourt_26.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_26.text: I've treated with beasts with more etiquette than you.

SnakesCourt_212.speaker: Narrator
SnakesCourt_212.text: *It's no use - the rage clouds all.*
SnakesCourt_212.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player character assumes an aggressive pre-combat stance - there's no way to avoid a fight now

SnakesCourt_77.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_77.text: She's just a cub. Let her go, or tangle with me.

SnakesCourt_226.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_226.text: Halsin is gone - I am First Druid now. I will take control and prove my authority.

SnakesCourt_238.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_238.text: You intrude on the circle. You intrude on my mind.

SnakesCourt_196.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_196.text: More proof that outsiders must never be trusted.

SnakesCourt_90.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_90.text: Tell the snake to be at ease. The girl must not be harmed.

SnakesCourt_249.speaker: Teela
SnakesCourt_249.text: Silence. I answer only to mistress.
SnakesCourt_249.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

SnakesCourt_64.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_64.text: Tell the snake to put Kagha at ease. The girl belongs with her own brood.

SnakesCourt_32.speaker: Teela
SnakesCourt_32.text: A new hatchling? Yes. They can be foolish.
SnakesCourt_32.context: NodeContext: Snakelike but not too cartoonish

SnakesCourt_19.speaker: Teela
SnakesCourt_19.text: Kagha si nay. Wux geou fulla wer fanol.
SnakesCourt_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: To KaghaNodeContext: To Kagha. Draconic snakey language. KA-ga see-NAY. wooks gyow fulla wur FAN-ole.

SnakesCourt_248.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_248.text: Ssifisv - it is as you say, Teela. Come to me.
SnakesCourt_248.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Teela the snake. A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.NodeContext: To Teela the snake. A snake-like sound: ss-ifff-iss-ff. A draconian language word. Commanding serpents to stand down.

SnakesCourt_107.speaker: Lae'zel
SnakesCourt_107.text: Let judgement be cast. Spill blood after, if you must.

SnakesCourt_223.speaker: Lae'zel
SnakesCourt_223.text: Wise. To know, we must first observe.

SnakesCourt_174.speaker: Shadowheart
SnakesCourt_174.text: Good. Play nice until we get what we need.

SnakesCourt_140.speaker: Karlach
SnakesCourt_140.text: That's it. You're calm, I'm calm, snake's calm.

SnakesCourt_44.speaker: Astarion
SnakesCourt_44.text: Don't be a coward. We could take them. We could kill them all.

SnakesCourt_201.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_201.text: Remand the thief. I will not say it again.

SnakesCourt_204.speaker: Wyll
SnakesCourt_204.text: A fickle one, aren't you? I hope you know what you're doing.

SnakesCourt_216.speaker: Gale
SnakesCourt_216.text: Good. Let's focus on the girl first. We can settle with the snake later.

SnakesCourt_245.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_245.text: The outlander must strike on Zevlor's behalf! Call the circle to arms - we will cleanse the grove of parasites, once and for all.
SnakesCourt_245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players and druids both enter combat stance.

SnakesCourt_41.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: After line, snake bares fangs (if possible) and combat begins.

SnakesCourt_43.speaker: Shadowheart
SnakesCourt_43.text: Leave it. Remember why we're here.

SnakesCourt_232.speaker: Karlach
SnakesCourt_232.text: Wait! Don't spook the gods-damn snake!

SnakesCourt_165.speaker: Wyll
SnakesCourt_165.text: This Kagha's barbaric. Know this: I've got your back.

SnakesCourt_97.speaker: Gale
SnakesCourt_97.text: Hold on! It's not too late to settle this without bloodshed.

SnakesCourt_124.speaker: Player
SnakesCourt_124.text: To reject the helpless is to reject Silvanus himself.

SnakesCourt_208.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_208.text: The Treefather's words spoken with a devil's forked tongue.

SnakesCourt_96.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_96.text: Perhaps you don't know that Silvanus spoke further. 'The parasite must be removed for new seed to grow.'

SnakesCourt_103.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_103.text: The Treefather's words. Your circle taught well.

SnakesCourt_67.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_67.text: You know, then, that Silvanus spoke further. 'The parasite must be removed for new seed to grow.'

SnakesCourt_192.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt_192.text: Yet behold: the parasite lives! She eats our food, drinks our water. Then steals our most holy idol in thanks!

PAD_KidDied_0.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied_0.text: The snake killed that girl in front of everyone. Is this grove worth a dead child?

PAD_KidDied_1.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied_1.text: The longer we stay here, the closer we come to reaching the same fate.
PAD_KidDied_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach just watched some druids accidentally kill a tiefling girl. She's stunned.

Denouncing_58.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_58.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing_15.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_15.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing_112.speaker: Rath
Denouncing_112.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing_80.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_80.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing_6.speaker: Player
Denouncing_6.text: Take this letter, Rath. It will explain everything.

Denouncing_57.speaker: Rath
Denouncing_57.text: What in the... Cloakwood? Kagha - have you lost your mind?!
Denouncing_57.context: NodeContext: Rath takes the letter from you and reads it, below frame. Places in back pocket.

Denouncing_64.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_64.text: Halsin is weak, Rath. But in the shadows, we are strong, we are safe. There is no other way.

Denouncing_113.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_113.text: You and Halsin welcome untouchables to your midst.

Denouncing_103.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_103.text: You defile the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing_3.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_3.text: Olodan speaks truth. Do you disagree, Rath? You would see this grove in ruin?
Denouncing_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Calling out to the group. After, |The camera looks at Rath, alone.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

Denouncing_73.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_73.text: The choice is made. Kagha: burn the tainted away. Start with the snitch.
Denouncing_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olodan turns to look at player with a sneer for the second line

Denouncing_110.speaker: Player
Denouncing_110.text: You're so desperate to be proven right - it's made you forget who you really are.

Denouncing_91.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_91.text: I - yes. When the darkest hour fell, it was us that brought light.

Denouncing_107.speaker: Player
Denouncing_107.text: Can't you feel how the prayer disturbs the soil and air? The grove trembles in fear.

Denouncing_8.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_8.text: It... it trembles in shame. It knows that in harmony, we perish. In shadow, we are pure.
Denouncing_8.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

Denouncing_22.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_22.text: The grove may thrive only when the great vine strangles those who imperil it.

Denouncing_111.speaker: Player
Denouncing_111.text: You are druids. You've an oath to uphold nature's harmony, its strength - stand by it.

Denouncing_26.speaker: Player
Denouncing_26.text: Harmony is not weakness - it is balance. Strength. Silvanus calls on you to preserve it.

Denouncing_59.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_59.text: No! You... you twist the teachings. In harmony, we perish. In shadow, we are pure.
Denouncing_59.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

Denouncing_77.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_77.text: *Kagha's voice breaks and her lips tremble. She heard reason in your words.*

Denouncing_97.speaker: Player
Denouncing_97.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Remind Kagha of the grove's legacy.

Denouncing_25.speaker: Player
Denouncing_25.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Instil her with pride in the grove's legacy.
Denouncing_25.context: InternalNodeContext: The player read and understood at least two of the frescos. These frescos are all around them in this area

Denouncing_48.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_48.text: When... when the darkest hour fell, it was us that brought light.

Denouncing_106.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_106.text: Silvanus demands we illuminate shadow, not hide within it.

Denouncing_29.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_29.text: How - how was I so blind?

Denouncing_54.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_54.text: Careful, Kagha. The shadows don't forgive.

Denouncing_95.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_95.text: I belong to the shadows no longer. You've no power over me!

Denouncing_61.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_61.text: You would question my power? Mother Earth, hear me. Grant me your wrath!

Denouncing_40.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_40.text: *Kagha eyes you intently as you speak the text etched into the frescoes.*

Denouncing_38.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_38.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

Denouncing_12.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_12.text:
*'The forest rose with claw and tooth
To tear the darkness from its roots.'*

Denouncing_43.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_43.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

Denouncing_86.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_86.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
The moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

Denouncing_65.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_65.text: Empty ramblings, all of them. While you obsess over yesterday, I will be making our tomorrow.

Denouncing_104.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_104.text: I take this grove for the shadows!

Denouncing_87.speaker: Player
Denouncing_87.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Remind Kagha of the grove's legacy.
Denouncing_87.context: InternalNodeContext: The player read and understood at least two of the frescos. These frescos are all around them in this area

Denouncing_85.speaker: Player
Denouncing_85.text: I know these druids' ways. All they touch is fated to decay.

Denouncing_1.speaker: Player
Denouncing_1.text: I know these druids' ways. In their hands, this grove will decay.

Denouncing_90.speaker: Player
Denouncing_90.text: You know I'm right. Don't let the shadows corrupt you.

Denouncing_4.speaker: Player
Denouncing_4.text: The shadows will only corrupt - you don't need them.

Denouncing_62.speaker: Player
Denouncing_62.text: I tried reasoning with you. Looks like it'll take blood to settle this.

Denouncing_98.speaker: Narrator
Denouncing_98.text: *You watch Kagha closely. If she is moved by your plea, she gives no sign.*

Denouncing_70.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_70.text: Silvanus calls on me to shield the circle, balance be damned.

Denouncing_50.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_50.text: Olodan, strike. We take this grove for the shadows!

Denouncing_101.speaker: Player
Denouncing_101.text: The shadows won't save you - they'll corrupt you. Stop this, while you can.

Denouncing_46.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_46.text: No! You... you don't know what you say. In shadow, we are purified.
Denouncing_46.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

Denouncing_39.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_39.text: The shadows don't corrupt us - they cleanse us.

Denouncing_109.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_109.text: With the grove taken for Cloakwood, the circle will see that I'm right. The Great Mother will guard us from all danger.

Denouncing_5.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_5.context: NodeContext: Shakes off the mindprobe attempt

Denouncing_99.speaker: Player
Denouncing_99.text: Take the grove - I won't stand in your way.

Denouncing_102.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_102.text: Oh, but you already have. Or does my memory fail so completely?

Denouncing_71.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_71.text: End them, Kagha. Unless you have... lost your nerve.

Denouncing_100.speaker: Player
Denouncing_100.text: Sometimes the old must burn for the new to flourish. I won't interfere.

Denouncing_69.speaker: Player
Denouncing_69.text: Spare my life, so I might join the Cloakwood druids.

Denouncing_13.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_13.text: No one joins the Shadow Druids. Oh, no - their presence is requested.

Denouncing_88.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_88.text: And I don't recall sending an invitation.

Denouncing_82.speaker: Player
Denouncing_82.text: You seem intent on forcing me to take your life. So be it.

Denouncing_55.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_55.text: Olodan speaks truth. Who among you disagrees? Who would see this grove in ruin?
Denouncing_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Loic, and finally Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

Denouncing_72.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_72.text: Olodan speaks truth. Who among you disagrees? Who would see this grove in ruin?
Denouncing_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Loic, and finally Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

Denouncing_79.speaker: Kagha
Denouncing_79.text: Olodan speaks truth. Do you disagree? Would you see this grove in ruin?
Denouncing_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

Denouncing_60.speaker: Player
Denouncing_60.text: Kagha's a Shadow Druid. She means to convert the circle.

Denouncing_23.speaker: Rath
Denouncing_23.text: A Shadow Druid? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

Denouncing_74.speaker: Player
Denouncing_74.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing_66.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_66.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing_21.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_21.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing_34.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing_34.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing_28.speaker: Rath
Denouncing_28.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

Denouncing_114.speaker: Player
Denouncing_114.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing_0.speaker: Rath
Denouncing_0.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation_0.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

PAD_FoundSecretLocation_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation_1.text: Hm - must be the tree from the note to Kagha. What's that cleft there?

AD_ReactToDeadKid_0.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid_0.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid_2.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid_2.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

001_0.speaker: Narrator
001_0.text: *The rat watches your movements but does not speak.*

001_10.speaker: Narrator
001_10.text: *You see a sharp intelligence behind its eyes. Is it a familiar or another druid enjoying their wildshape?*

001_15.speaker: Narrator
001_15.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001_4.speaker: Narrator
001_4.text: *...then slips into view. The spectre of Shadow Druids in animal form, right under your feet.*

001_11.speaker: Player
001_11.text: I know the truth. You are a Shadow Druid.

001_13.speaker: Narrator
001_13.text: *The creature's whiskers go still for a moment before resuming their nervous jitter.*

001_7.speaker: Narrator
001_7.text: *The rat is otherwise silent in the face of your accusation.*

001_14.speaker: Narrator
001_14.text: *...what if it's neither pest nor familiar - but another druid in animal form?*

001_6.speaker: Narrator
001_6.text: *...then slips into view. Kagha's rats might not be simple familiars, but shapeshifted Shadow Druids.*

001_9.speaker: Narrator
001_9.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

LeaderPersuaded_13.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_13.text: Rath thought me a danger. Seems I've proven him right.

LeaderPersuaded_21.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_21.text: You once called me a monster. Seems I've proven you right.

LeaderPersuaded_37.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_37.text: A child is dead. I betrayed the circle's trust. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.

LeaderPersuaded_50.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_50.text: My fate lies with Silvanus, may He have mercy.

LeaderPersuaded_33.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_33.text: We will grant them safe harbour until they depart.

LeaderPersuaded_14.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_14.text: Meanwhile, help us contend with the goblins. Perhaps we can dissuade them from attacking.

LeaderPersuaded_65.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_65.text: How did the Shadow Druids even find you?

LeaderPersuaded_1.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_1.text: It began with a letter. There was no messenger - it simply... appeared.

LeaderPersuaded_11.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_11.text: Olodan came soon after. An army was coming, she said. Goblins, drow, and more still - legions upon legions.

LeaderPersuaded_62.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_62.text: The druids of Cloakwood knew the dangers this would bring. They ordained that all circles cast the rite to shelter from the storm.

LeaderPersuaded_20.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_20.text: Olodan taught me to harness the Treefather's power to wall us in. In return...

LeaderPersuaded_19.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_19.text: ...well. You know the rest. I would turn the grove over to them.

LeaderPersuaded_46.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_46.text: I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I trust First Druid Halsin will heal them in time.

LeaderPersuaded_5.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_5.text: I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I pray Halsin returns to heal them in full.

LeaderPersuaded_12.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_12.text: I won't forget the wounds I've inflicted. I trust Silvanus will heal them in time.

LeaderPersuaded_45.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_45.text: Silvanus may very well grant your wish. Traitors have died for lesser offences.

LeaderPersuaded_31.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_31.text: However He judges, I will comply.

LeaderPersuaded_39.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_39.text: I endangered a child. I betrayed the circle's trust. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.

LeaderPersuaded_54.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_54.text: You're damned right. Joining the Shadow Druids? What were you thinking?

LeaderPersuaded_48.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_48.text: I was thinking I could make us safe. A foolish notion, to think we'd find comfort in shadow.

LeaderPersuaded_51.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_51.text: Power's lure is strong. I know it well.

LeaderPersuaded_56.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_56.text: It was through power that I would keep us safe. Or so I thought.

LeaderPersuaded_36.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_36.text: Yet I led a child to her death, betrayed the circle to shadow. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.

LeaderPersuaded_41.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_41.text: Yet I betrayed Silvanus himself, led the circle to shadow. We will stop the rite and I will stand trial.

LeaderPersuaded_53.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_53.text: Protecting the circle was natural - but you chose the wrong path.

LeaderPersuaded_55.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_55.text: You speak more kindly than I deserve. I led a child to her death, betrayed the circle to shadow.

LeaderPersuaded_3.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_3.text: I betrayed Silvanus himself, led the circle to shadow.

LeaderPersuaded_6.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_6.text: We will stop the rite and I will stand trial. My fate lies with the Treefather, may He have mercy.

LeaderPersuaded_15.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_15.text: You were ready to give up the circle to Cloakwood. It's unthinkable.

LeaderPersuaded_17.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_17.text: I can hardly deny it. I was so cloaked in shadow, little light could pierce through.

LeaderPersuaded_63.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_63.text: How grateful I am that yours shone so brightly.

LeaderPersuaded_23.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_23.text: We will stop the rite and I will stand trial. My fate lies with the Treefather, may He have mercy.

LeaderPersuaded_38.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_38.text: Silvanus bid me to protect my people from harm. Yet I was the one to inflict it.

LeaderPersuaded_9.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_9.text: There was but one druid who guarded the circle, who protected our ways. We are forever in your debt.

LeaderPersuaded_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kagha produces a magical staff and gives to the player.

LeaderPersuaded_2.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_2.text: You burn like fire, you howl like wind. You are Faithwarden.

LeaderPersuaded_8.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_8.text: Take our gift and be known. May I not be the last monster you vanquish.

LeaderPersuaded_27.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_27.text: What does it mean to be Faithwarden?

LeaderPersuaded_7.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_7.text: When you speak, the circles will listen. Among druids, your words will shine brighter than sun.

LeaderPersuaded_59.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_59.text: Joining the Shadow Druids? What were you thinking?

LeaderPersuaded_61.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_61.text: You were lured by power. I've faced the same struggle.

LeaderPersuaded_42.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPersuaded_42.text: Rath thought me a danger. Seems I've proven him right.

LeaderPersuaded_29.speaker: Player
LeaderPersuaded_29.text: What about Zevlor - can his people stay?

AD_SnakesCourt_4.speaker: Rath
AD_SnakesCourt_4.text: Have you lost your senses, Kagha? Release her!

AD_SnakesCourt_1.speaker: Kagha
AD_SnakesCourt_1.text: She stole the Idol of Silvanus. She must pay the price.

AD_SnakesCourt_6.speaker: Kagha
AD_SnakesCourt_6.text: We will imprison the thief under guard of my serpent.

AD_SnakesCourt_3.speaker: Kagha
AD_SnakesCourt_3.text: When we cast out the rest, she may join them.

AD_SnakesCourt_0.speaker: Kagha
AD_SnakesCourt_0.text: Let the devil be an example: we will tolerate outlanders no longer.
AD_SnakesCourt_0.context: NodeContext: Said to the crowd. Like a judge to the courtroom.

AD_SnakesCourt_2.speaker: Kagha
AD_SnakesCourt_2.text: The grove will be made safe. The circle will be closed!
AD_SnakesCourt_2.context: NodeContext: Said to the crowd. Like a judge to the courtroom.

SelfReflection_9.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_9.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection_7.speaker: Player
SelfReflection_7.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection_8.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_8.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection_0.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_0.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection_3.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_3.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

SelfReflection_6.speaker: Player
SelfReflection_6.text: Lament Kagha's anger. She treads a dangerous path.

SelfReflection_5.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_5.text: *Nature seeks balance, yet in Kagha you see more shadow than light.*

SelfReflection_1.speaker: Player
SelfReflection_1.text: Free your mind. The nature of Kagha's magic is not yours to question.

SelfReflection_10.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_10.text: *Your mind rests, but the circle's prayer still resonates in the air.*

SelfReflection_2.speaker: Player
SelfReflection_2.text: Ponder Kagha's passion. You heard truth in her words.

SelfReflection_4.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection_4.text: *A circle in danger closes ranks. Yet Kagha alone could not draw on the rite's power.*

Opposed_5.speaker: Rath
Opposed_5.text: I wish I could offer more assistance. For now, I must keep a close watch on Kagha.

Opposed_7.speaker: Rath
Opposed_7.text: I hope to see both you and Halsin again soon.

Opposed_15.speaker: Rath
Opposed_15.text: You have saved Kagha from herself. I cannot thank you enough.

Opposed_21.speaker: Rath
Opposed_21.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed_46.speaker: Player
Opposed_46.text: A child is dead. You don't deserve mercy.

Opposed_2.speaker: Rath
Opposed_2.text: You may be right. We've let a snake replace our leader. And the result... By the Treefather, that girl...

Opposed_50.speaker: Player
Opposed_50.text: That snake must be held accountable.

Opposed_40.speaker: Rath
Opposed_40.text: By every star, by every vein on every leaf, she must.

Opposed_73.speaker: Rath
Opposed_73.text: This has only happened because our true leader was taken from us.

Opposed_8.speaker: Player
Opposed_8.text: Kagha seems happy to rule the roost. Who's your real leader?

Opposed_9.speaker: Rath
Opposed_9.text: Master Halsin. Perhaps goblin-caught, perhaps dead. He'd set... Mistress Kagha back in line. Hold her to task. Stop this damned ritual.

Opposed_25.speaker: Rath
Opposed_25.text: More will die if the rite is finished. So many more, sent into a world gone mad...

Opposed_19.speaker: Player
Opposed_19.text: If no one's looking for Halsin, I could do it.

Opposed_30.speaker: Rath
Opposed_30.text: Would you? I would give anything to see Halsin return home.

Opposed_71.speaker: Player
Opposed_71.text: No need to fret. I'll find him.

Opposed_92.speaker: Rath
Opposed_92.text: Silvanus' blessing upon you. And my gratitude as well.

Opposed_14.speaker: Player
Opposed_14.text: I'd like a more solid offer than 'anything'.

Opposed_81.speaker: Rath
Opposed_81.text: Our need is great. I will open the treasures of this grove to you, even if the circle forbids it.

Opposed_22.speaker: Rath
Opposed_22.text: Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear. He left west, with the adventurers.

Opposed_94.speaker: Rath
Opposed_94.text: You won't mistake the First Druid for anyone else.

Opposed_70.speaker: Rath
Opposed_70.text: Your dismissal is no shield. Kagha will ensure all outsiders are driven from the grove.

Opposed_42.speaker: Rath
Opposed_42.text: Should you change your mind, head west. Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear.

Opposed_96.speaker: Player
Opposed_96.text: I found Halsin in the goblin camp, but he can't return yet.

Opposed_3.speaker: Rath
Opposed_3.text: Please, do whatever you must to get him home. The grove needs him.

Opposed_4.speaker: Player
Opposed_4.text: I found Halsin in the goblin camp, but he didn't survive.

Opposed_58.speaker: Player
Opposed_58.text: I'm in need of a healer. Badly.

Opposed_59.speaker: Rath
Opposed_59.text: Like many, you seek Halsin's craft. But you'll have to settle for Nettie.

Opposed_66.speaker: Rath
Opposed_66.text: Find her further in the cave. Her gift is great, too - you can trust her.
Opposed_66.context: InternalNodeContext: show this only if the player didn't already find Halsin, no need to be redundant if the player already knows

Opposed_83.speaker: Player
Opposed_83.text: Sounds like Halsin might be the better bet. Where is he?

Opposed_41.speaker: Rath
Opposed_41.text: The adventurers say they lost track of him in a temple to the west.

Opposed_90.speaker: Rath
Opposed_90.text: Would that I could track himself myself. But I cannot leave with Kagha doing as she wills.

Opposed_16.speaker: Player
Opposed_16.text: I'll take my chances on Nettie.

Opposed_57.speaker: Rath
Opposed_57.text: I pray she can heal what ails you.

Opposed_54.speaker: Rath
Opposed_54.text: Ah, I see. You will find her deeper in the caves.

Opposed_77.speaker: Rath
Opposed_77.text: It is what Kagha desires. I doubt it is what Silvanus wants.

Opposed_27.speaker: Player
Opposed_27.text: The girl's parents will want vengeance.

Opposed_61.speaker: Rath
Opposed_61.text: This is how a terrible cycle begins. All is out of balance.

Opposed_45.speaker: Rath
Opposed_45.text: We need Master Halsin. Without him, Kagha's ritual will divide this grove forever.

Opposed_48.speaker: Player
Opposed_48.text: That girl's parents want vengeance - and they deserve it.

Opposed_20.speaker: Player
Opposed_20.text: How did Kagha take over the whole grove?

Opposed_13.speaker: Rath
Opposed_13.text: She is First Druid in Halsin's absence. With him caught - or dead - by goblins, none may gainsay her.

Opposed_69.speaker: Rath
Opposed_69.text: But more will die if her ritual is finished. I doubt those exiled by the rite will survive long outside.

Opposed_17.speaker: Player
Opposed_17.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed_78.speaker: Rath
Opposed_78.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed_29.speaker: Rath
Opposed_29.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

Opposed_43.speaker: Player
Opposed_43.text: You let Kagha befoul this sacred place with a child's blood, yet you plead 'mercy'? Coward.

Opposed_28.speaker: Rath
Opposed_28.text: May he rest in Summeroak forever. I...
Opposed_28.context: InternalNodeContext: HALSIN IS DEADNodeContext: Grieving, voice trailing off.

Opposed_11.speaker: Rath
Opposed_11.text: ...I apologise. I must have some time to myself.

Opposed_44.speaker: Rath
Opposed_44.text: I hope to see Halsin return so he can help us heal.

Opposed_86.speaker: Rath
Opposed_86.text: Please, if you find him, let me know.

Opposed_56.speaker: Rath
Opposed_56.text: I pray the Treefather nourishes Kagha's wounded soul, now that she is dead.
Opposed_56.context: InternalNodeContext: Kagha Turned good but died in the fight against the shadow druids

Opposed_62.speaker: Rath
Opposed_62.text: You did well to speak up for the girl. That snake is fickle. A tragedy prevented.
Opposed_62.context: NodeContext: Grateful for the player's help, irritated at the 'snake' (Kagha)

Opposed_63.speaker: Rath
Opposed_63.text: Well seen. Well spotted. We've let a snake replace our leader.

Opposed_6.speaker: Player
Opposed_6.text: And if I hadn't spoken up? What would have happened?

Opposed_0.speaker: Rath
Opposed_0.text: Nothing befitting a child. Nothing befitting any of our world's creatures.

Opposed_12.speaker: Rath
Opposed_12.text: We've let a snake replace our leader. She will see the tieflings driven out, or worse.

Opposed_89.speaker: Player
Opposed_89.text: I've heard there's some sort of ritual going on.

Opposed_79.speaker: Rath
Opposed_79.text: One meant to seal us in. Meant to seal them out. Blasphemous. The Treefather must see what's happening in his holy grove.

Opposed_36.speaker: Rath
Opposed_36.text: Perhaps his eyes are on Master Halsin now.

Opposed_85.speaker: Player
Opposed_85.text: I swore an oath to stop terrible deeds like that. Monsters like her.

Opposed_74.speaker: Rath
Opposed_74.text: Until Master Halsin returns, my eyes must stay on Kagha.

Opposed_87.speaker: Rath
Opposed_87.text: To think Kagha had turned to the ways of shadow. Her corruption ran so deep.

Opposed_37.speaker: Rath
Opposed_37.text: Yet for her to die like this, under the Treefather's gaze... perhaps it is justice.

Opposed_10.speaker: Rath
Opposed_10.text: If only justice soothed my heart. A grove drenched in blood is no sanctuary at all.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_1.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_0.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter_2.text: Shadow Druids at work - and this Kagha is their newest recruit.

LeaderSaved_1.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_1.text: Halsin's cancelled the rite and I will face judgement. My fate belongs with the Treefather.

LeaderSaved_13.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_13.text: Peace. Enjoy it while it lasts.

LeaderSaved_19.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_19.text: I have been so blind, that an outsider would show me the way of Silvanus.

LeaderSaved_25.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_25.text: After all I've done, you've no reason to believe me, but... I'm grateful.

LeaderSaved_3.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_3.text: Halsin's cancelled the rite and I will face judgement. My fate belongs with the Treefather.

LeaderSaved_5.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_5.text: I sought the shadows and imperilled the grove. Thanks to you, I've seen light.

LeaderSaved_9.speaker: Player
LeaderSaved_9.text: This wasn't for you. It was to spare that girl's parents.

LeaderSaved_17.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_17.text: Then trust when I say I bear their burden along with my own.

LeaderSaved_21.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_21.text: Justice will be done - the circle will see to that. Cold comfort for them, but comfort nonetheless.

LeaderSaved_14.speaker: Player
LeaderSaved_14.text: The light welcomes even those who have strayed.

LeaderSaved_4.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_4.text: I'll use it to heal blight wherever it reaches.

LeaderSaved_12.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_12.text: And I'll remember a serpent lives within me, waiting to strike. Treefather guide me, that I choose my targets more wisely.

LeaderSaved_6.speaker: Player
LeaderSaved_6.text: Don't let me think about it too long. I'll start having regrets.

LeaderSaved_18.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_18.text: Then I won't stretch your patience. But do allow me one last word:

LeaderSaved_0.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_0.text: 'Mercy'. You carry it with you. And now I must carry it with me.

LeaderSaved_10.speaker: Player
LeaderSaved_10.text: Saving you was one matter. Forgiving you is another.

LeaderSaved_11.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_11.text: Don't saddle yourself with that loathing. I will carry it for us both.

LeaderSaved_16.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_16.text: You can trust that Silvanus will punish me for it twice over.

LeaderSaved_2.speaker: Player
LeaderSaved_2.text: May the sun rise in the valley...

LeaderSaved_15.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_15.text: ...and may the wind carry you to mount's peak. Until we meet again.

LeaderSaved_7.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_7.text: I will cancel the rite and subject myself to the circle for judgement.

LeaderSaved_23.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_23.text: The grove is forever in your debt. Walk freely among us for as long as the sun sets and rises.

LeaderSaved_24.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved_24.text: You saved my life. I won't forget it.

AD_OpposedPacified_0.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_0.text: So much death. So little justice.

AD_OpposedPacified_1.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_1.text: How could I have been so blind?

AD_OpposedPacified_2.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_2.text: I should have seen the signs. She had gone too far.

AD_OpposedPacified_3.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_3.text: Halsin will find us in ruin. We have lost so much.

AD_OpposedPacified_4.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_4.text: If only you had said something, Kagha. I would have helped you.

AD_OpposedPacified_5.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_5.text: May Silvanus' grace teach you in death what you did not learn in life, Kagha.

AD_OpposedPacified_8.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified_8.text: Such is betrayal: a poison that destroys its wielder.

003_1.speaker: Narrator
003_1.text: *The creature's eyes briefly meet yours before looking away.*

003_5.speaker: Narrator
003_5.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

003_12.speaker: Narrator
003_12.text: *...then slips into view. The spectre of Shadow Druids in animal form, right under your feet.*

003_2.speaker: Narrator
003_2.text: *...what if it's neither pest nor familiar - but another druid in animal form?*

003_6.speaker: Player
003_6.text: I know the truth. You are a Shadow Druid.

003_9.speaker: Narrator
003_9.text: *The creature's whiskers go still for a moment before resuming their nervous jitter.*

003_8.speaker: Narrator
003_8.text: *The rat is otherwise silent in the face of your accusation.*

003_11.speaker: Narrator
003_11.text: *...then slips into view. Kagha's rats might not be simple familiars, but shapeshifted Shadow Druids.*

003_3.speaker: Narrator
003_3.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

003_10.speaker: Narrator
003_10.text: *The rat doesn't respond - it simply bares its teeth.*

003_13.speaker: Narrator
003_13.text: *You see a sharp intelligence behind its eyes. Is it a familiar or another druid enjoying their wildshape?*

002_11.speaker: Narrator
002_11.text: *The rat glares at you but says nothing.*

002_13.speaker: Narrator
002_13.text: *You see a sharp intelligence behind its eyes. Is it a familiar or another druid enjoying their wildshape?*

002_15.speaker: Narrator
002_15.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

002_8.speaker: Narrator
002_8.text: *...then slips into view. The spectre of Shadow Druids in animal form, right under your feet.*

002_7.speaker: Narrator
002_7.text: *...what if it's neither pest nor familiar - but another druid in animal form?*

002_9.speaker: Player
002_9.text: I know the truth. You are a Shadow Druid.

002_14.speaker: Narrator
002_14.text: *The creature's whiskers go still for a moment before resuming their nervous jitter.*

002_12.speaker: Narrator
002_12.text: *The rat is otherwise silent in the face of your accusation.*

002_10.speaker: Narrator
002_10.text: *...then slips into view. Kagha's rats might not be simple familiars, but shapeshifted Shadow Druids.*

002_2.speaker: Narrator
002_2.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Leader_12.speaker: Kagha
Leader_12.text: A deep elf - in our grove, on this day. A sign. Or rather, a gift.

Leader_35.speaker: Kagha
Leader_35.text: Who better to understand a watchful broodmother than a beloved child of Lolth?

Leader_7.speaker: Player
Leader_7.text: I'm nothing like you - I don't kill children.

Leader_141.speaker: Kagha
Leader_141.text: Bah. I'd thought one like you might understand. When a threat makes itself known, you remove it.

Leader_61.speaker: Player
Leader_61.text: I don't make a habit of threatening children.

Leader_166.speaker: Player
Leader_166.text: You protected your own without hesitation - my compliments.

Leader_168.speaker: Kagha
Leader_168.text: And yet you petitioned on the thief's behalf. A curious display of mercy.

Leader_173.speaker: Kagha
Leader_173.text: Then we agree. Preservation is not luxury, it is not zealotry. It is necessity.

Leader_36.speaker: Player
Leader_36.text: I'd have killed the thief outright.

Leader_40.speaker: Kagha
Leader_40.text: And still you petitioned on her behalf. Your words are vicious, yet you showed mercy.

Leader_149.speaker: Kagha
Leader_149.text: A viper bares her fangs defending her brood. Is it not her nature to strike at invaders?

Leader_176.speaker: Kagha
Leader_176.text: Yes. Yes. This could be the true way of Silvanus.

Leader_192.speaker: Kagha
Leader_192.text: The viper bares her fangs defending her brood. It is only right that she strike the killing blow.

Leader_100.speaker: Kagha
Leader_100.text: The others might consider this sacrilege. But we know the truth: it is necessity.

Leader_118.speaker: Kagha
Leader_118.text: I took back the Idol of Silvanus and the rite has resumed. We will seal the grove. Free from harm. Free of intruders.

Leader_74.speaker: Player
Leader_74.text: Please - we have nothing in common.

Leader_1.speaker: Kagha
Leader_1.text: Don't we? I've studied duergar culture. You have an instinct for survival.

Leader_127.speaker: Kagha
Leader_127.text: A viper bares her fangs defending her brood. Is it not her nature to strike at invaders?

Leader_152.speaker: Kagha
Leader_152.text: Don't we? I've studied drow culture. You have a talent for self-preservation.

Leader_159.speaker: Player
Leader_159.text: I have no love for the Queen of Spiders.

Leader_27.speaker: Kagha
Leader_27.text: Indeed? But you do exhibit a talent for self-preservation.

Leader_43.speaker: Player
Leader_43.text: I worship Eilistraee - not the Queen of Spiders.

Leader_30.speaker: Kagha
Leader_30.text: Indeed? Then above all, you must have a talent for self-preservation.

Leader_31.speaker: Kagha
Leader_31.text: Away. I have no more need of you.

Leader_53.speaker: Kagha
Leader_53.text: Indeed? Then when the lightning comes, it has one fewer to strike.

Leader_202.speaker: Kagha
Leader_202.text: I do hope you didn't come expecting my thanks. That would be most perplexing.

Leader_63.speaker: Kagha
Leader_63.text: Why are you here? I sent you to Zevlor.

Leader_70.speaker: Kagha
Leader_70.text: Go on. Say it. You think I'm a monster.

Leader_161.speaker: Wyll
Leader_161.text: Monster? Too kind. A demon, more like.

Leader_44.speaker: Player
Leader_44.text: Do you expect pity? You killed a child in cold blood.

Leader_78.speaker: Kagha
Leader_78.text: You've the skin of a beast. If only your heart was so bold.

Leader_116.speaker: Kagha
Leader_116.text: I know your kind. You see only victims and villains.

Leader_29.speaker: Player
Leader_29.text: Only a monster would threaten a child.

Leader_72.speaker: Kagha
Leader_72.text: I know your kind from other circles. You see only villains and victims.

Leader_25.speaker: Kagha
Leader_25.text: A viper bares her fangs defending her brood. I call her mother. You call her monster.

Leader_105.speaker: Kagha
Leader_105.text: Yes - you would say so. I know your kind. You see only villains and victims.

Leader_165.speaker: Player
Leader_165.text: You're protecting your own - sometimes cruelty is required.

Leader_106.speaker: Kagha
Leader_106.text: First you urge grace. Then you speak truth. To think a devil could surprise me twice over.

Leader_71.speaker: Kagha
Leader_71.text: First you urge grace. Then you speak truth. You've surprised me twice over.

Leader_32.speaker: Kagha
Leader_32.text: A shame the grace period ends. The viper's fangs have been bared. She must guard her brood.

Leader_164.speaker: Kagha
Leader_164.text: First, you stay silent. Then, you speak truth. To think an outsider could surprise me twice over.

Leader_191.speaker: Player
Leader_191.text: Honestly, I just wanted to see what would happen.

Leader_66.speaker: Kagha
Leader_66.text: Ah - you don't see a monster. You just look at me through one's eyes.

Leader_104.speaker: Kagha
Leader_104.text: You are like all the rest. Where devils tread, chaos follows.

Leader_5.speaker: Kagha
Leader_5.text: You are like the devils. Where they tread, chaos follows.

Leader_201.speaker: Kagha
Leader_201.text: No matter. I took back the Idol of Silvanus and the rite has resumed. We will seal the grove. Free from harm. Free of intruders.

Leader_19.speaker: Player
Leader_19.text: I know the truth. You mean to take the grove for the Shadow Druids.

Leader_64.speaker: Kagha
Leader_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The rats transform into Druids. This leads to the Denouncing scene.

Leader_37.speaker: Player
Leader_37.text: This rite must be born of powerful magic.

Leader_98.speaker: Kagha
Leader_98.text: The Rite of Thorns. It is the Treefather's gift, that none come to harm. When we speak the final prayer, the Great Vine will sprout forth.

Leader_187.speaker: Kagha
Leader_187.text: The grove will be cloaked in bramble and thorn. No one enters, no one leaves. Sanctuary.

Leader_148.speaker: Narrator
Leader_148.text: *Past teachings come into focus. The Rite of Thorns is a rare practice, outlawed in most circles for causing more harm than it eases.*

Leader_111.speaker: Kagha
Leader_111.text: None of this can happen while outlanders infect us. Silvanus demands that we choke them out.

Leader_20.speaker: Player
Leader_20.text: You'd leave them to die on the road.

Leader_95.speaker: Kagha
Leader_95.text: I am First Druid now. I protect the circle, whatever the cost.

Leader_82.speaker: Player
Leader_82.text: I came on Zevlor's behalf. His people could perish if you force them out.

Leader_177.speaker: Kagha
Leader_177.text: And mine perish if he stays.

Leader_0.speaker: Player
Leader_0.text: What does forcing them out achieve? They've done nothing.

Leader_109.speaker: Player
Leader_109.text: You must let them stay. They've done nothing to harm you.

Leader_138.speaker: Player
Leader_138.text: You cast out the guiltless. You shame your order.

Leader_26.speaker: Player
Leader_26.text: Turning your back on the needy - is this truly the way of Silvanus?

Leader_10.speaker: Kagha
Leader_10.text: 'A disease of the flower must not reach the root. Pluck the petals. Sever the branch if you must. But cut out the rot before it infects the whole of the wood.'

Leader_56.speaker: Kagha
Leader_56.text: Teachings of Silvanus, you must agree.

Leader_23.speaker: Kagha
Leader_23.text: Teachings of the Treefather. Do you agree?

Leader_134.speaker: Player
Leader_134.text: I know the Treefather's teachings as well as you.

Leader_131.speaker: Kagha
Leader_131.text: Then you know I heed his wisdom. I protect the circle, whatever the cost.

Leader_194.speaker: Kagha
Leader_194.text: You showed great mettle at the gate - the mettle of a skilled sword for hire.

Leader_125.speaker: Player
Leader_125.text: I hardly know every line of doctrine.

Leader_203.speaker: Kagha
Leader_203.text: Then why do you doubt my acts and intent?

Leader_58.speaker: Kagha
Leader_58.text: You showed great mettle at the gate - the mettle of a skilled sword for hire.

Leader_172.speaker: Kagha
Leader_172.text: They're to be gone before final prayer. If they are not...

Leader_86.speaker: Player
Leader_86.text: The viper can stand down. Zevlor is already dead.

Leader_157.speaker: Kagha
Leader_157.text: Indeed? Then removing his people should provide you little challenge.

Leader_14.speaker: Player
Leader_14.text: I'll see what can be done about them.

Leader_92.speaker: Kagha
Leader_92.text: This tale ends but one way: with the outlander rot cleansed and the grove forever shrouded.

Leader_167.speaker: Player
Leader_167.text: I've done enough. They're your problem, not mine.

Leader_128.speaker: Kagha
Leader_128.text: Then they soon know the sting of my venom.

Leader_188.speaker: Kagha
Leader_188.text: Get out. We have no more business.

Leader_126.speaker: Player
Leader_126.text: Then it seems I'd best speak to Zevlor.

Leader_88.speaker: Kagha
Leader_88.text: You will do more than speak.

Leader_124.speaker: Player
Leader_124.text: Prattle all you want. The refugees aren't my concern.

Leader_38.speaker: Kagha
Leader_38.text: I want you to provide your services to the tiefling leader - Zevlor, he's called. Offer to guide the outlanders out of the grove. I'm sure they'll reward you well.

Leader_162.speaker: Kagha
Leader_162.text: I want you to provide your services to Zevlor. Offer to guide the outlanders out of the grove. I'm sure they'll reward you well.

Leader_120.speaker: Player
Leader_120.text: Words you have twisted to justify your cruelty.

Leader_175.speaker: Kagha
Leader_175.text: Words I heed to the letter to keep my brood safe.

Leader_85.speaker: Player
Leader_85.text: Turning your back on the needy - is this truly the way of Silvanus?

Leader_87.speaker: Player
Leader_87.text: Do what you want. It's none of my concern.

Leader_76.speaker: Kagha
Leader_76.text: So you say. Yet you share their infernal blood.

Leader_102.speaker: Kagha
Leader_102.text: Ah yes. You like to meddle. See what happens. So let me tell you what happens next.

Leader_123.speaker: Kagha
Leader_123.text: You will offer your services to the tieflings' leader - Zevlor, he's called. And you will guide the outlanders out of the grove.

Leader_184.speaker: Kagha
Leader_184.text: You will offer your services to Zevlor, guide the outlanders out of the grove.

Leader_16.speaker: Kagha
Leader_16.text: Then I was wise to grant you entry. And you'd be wise to heed my words.

Leader_144.speaker: Kagha
Leader_144.text: So you say. Yet you share their infernal blood. And the child walks free.

Leader_21.speaker: Kagha
Leader_21.text: So you say. Yet the child walks free.

Leader_6.speaker: Lae'zel
Leader_6.text: Stay your hand. This is neither the time nor the place.

Leader_150.speaker: Kagha
Leader_150.text: Have you finished your chatter? Then you will give me your ear.

Leader_196.speaker: Shadowheart
Leader_196.text: Keep talking. Nothing to be gained in picking a fight with a fanatic.

Leader_34.speaker: Karlach
Leader_34.text: Hang on. If we play this right, we might be able to stop this before it starts.

Leader_174.speaker: Astarion
Leader_174.context: NodeContext: You've been bored, now you're ready to rip someone's throat out.

Leader_73.speaker: Wyll
Leader_73.text: Think it through. Anger Kagha, and the whole grove could suffer.

Leader_170.speaker: Gale
Leader_170.text: Hold. Give diplomacy a chance to do its job.

Leader_96.speaker: Kagha
Leader_96.text: The outlander serves Zevlor! Circle - to arms. Let no parasite live!

Leader_135.speaker: Player
Leader_135.text: Zevlor sent me. His people won't survive out there.

Leader_178.speaker: Kagha
Leader_178.text: They may die on the road.

Leader_193.speaker: Kagha
Leader_193.text: They will die if they stay.

Leader_57.speaker: Kagha
Leader_57.text: A clear choice, I would say.

Leader_133.speaker: Player
Leader_133.text: Zevlor believes his people will perish on the road.

Leader_151.speaker: Player
Leader_151.text: You can't just force these people out.

Leader_81.speaker: Player
Leader_81.text: What does forcing them out achieve? They've done nothing.

Leader_68.speaker: Player
Leader_68.text: Free from the threat of little children?

Leader_55.speaker: Kagha
Leader_55.text: She stole the Idol of Silvanus during prayer, and interrupted the rite.

Leader_101.speaker: Kagha
Leader_101.text: Why, I don't know or care.

Leader_163.speaker: Player
Leader_163.text: Not at all. That was quite a show.

Leader_59.speaker: Kagha
Leader_59.text: Monsters both, then. Viper to viper. Beast to beast.

Leader_51.speaker: Kagha
Leader_51.text: Monsters both, then. Viper to viper.

Leader_180.speaker: Player
Leader_180.text: That depends. It was an accident - wasn't it?

Leader_117.speaker: Kagha
Leader_117.text: Accidents do not exist. There is only choice and consequence.

Leader_99.speaker: Kagha
Leader_99.text: The devilspawn imperilled my brood. I bared my fangs to defend it. Choice. Consequence.

Leader_97.speaker: Kagha
Leader_97.text: Now the Idol of Silvanus is returned and the rite has resumed. We will seal the grove. Free from harm. Free of intruders.

Leader_119.speaker: Player
Leader_119.text: Your iron will is impressive - if a touch inflexible.

Leader_139.speaker: Kagha
Leader_139.text: You speak in paradox. I care not for steel, but I know if it bends - it breaks. I will not allow this grove to be broken.

Leader_113.speaker: Player
Leader_113.text: The Rite of Thorns is risky magic. Is it not banned in your circle?

Leader_160.speaker: Kagha
Leader_160.text: And if it is? Strangers are the scourge; the rite is the remedy. No laws can change that.

Leader_22.speaker: Player
Leader_22.text: This rite must be born of powerful magic.

Leader_199.speaker: Player
Leader_199.text: I'm told there is a healer here. Where is she?

Leader_190.speaker: Kagha
Leader_190.text: Nettie, yes. She's bumbling about somewhere.

Leader_24.speaker: Kagha
Leader_24.text: But if your treatment is meant to outlast the rite, you'll be removed with the rest.

Leader_50.speaker: Player
Leader_50.text: Zevlor's people need refuge. You can't deny them that.

Leader_28.speaker: Player
Leader_28.text: That child - what was her crime?

Leader_42.speaker: Player
Leader_42.text: Zevlor wants you removed. I'm here to see it done.

Leader_89.speaker: Kagha
Leader_89.text: A grey dwarf - in our grove, on this day. A sign. Or rather, a gift.

Leader_52.speaker: Kagha
Leader_52.text: Who better to understand a watchful broodmother than one who hails from... below?

LeaderPostGoblins_6.speaker: Player
LeaderPostGoblins_6.text: Halsin is dead. I thought you should know.

LeaderPostGoblins_27.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_27.text: He turned his back on the circle to stumble after the past. How fitting that it's consumed him.

LeaderPostGoblins_4.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_4.text: Well. A broodmother looks forward, never back. I am First Druid now. And I will keep my children safe.

LeaderPostGoblins_13.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_13.text: The tieflings are grateful for your efforts, as well should they be.

LeaderPostGoblins_29.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_29.text: Master Halsin would approve. I pray he still returns, Silvanus willing.

LeaderPostGoblins_15.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_15.text: Finally, we'll be rid of the outlanders' infernal stench.

LeaderPostGoblins_11.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_11.text: The last prayer will be spoken and the rite will conclude. When the coming army swarms, the brambles will keep us safe.

LeaderPostGoblins_30.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_30.text: I suppose you want thanks. I'm sure the tieflings have plenty.

LeaderPostGoblins_2.speaker: Player
LeaderPostGoblins_2.text: I've discovered the truth. You're allied with Shadow Druids.

LeaderPostGoblins_28.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_28.text: Have you now? And you thought you should tell me?

LeaderPostGoblins_17.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_17.text: We will execute the Rite of Thorns, and you will give no more complaint. In fact...

LeaderPostGoblins_18.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_18.text: ...you will be gone before the sun next sets on the grove.

LeaderPostGoblins_22.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_22.text: There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve.

LeaderPostGoblins_21.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_21.text: The grove is forever in your debt. Walk freely among us for as long as the sun sets and rises.

LeaderPostGoblins_31.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_31.text: We're grateful for your efforts - though none more than the refugees.

LeaderPostGoblins_24.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_24.text: There is cause for celebration. Master Halsin would approve of this.

LeaderPostGoblins_12.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_12.text: He's... he's really gone, then. That means...

LeaderPostGoblins_26.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_26.text: Treefather, make us tall as the ash and stout as the spruce. I...

LeaderPostGoblins_8.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_8.text: Oh, hells - the prayer can wait. I'm... I'm going to miss him.

LeaderPostGoblins_32.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins_32.text: Peace. Enjoy it while it lasts.

AD_OpposedDenounce_4.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_4.text: The first letter from Cloakwood came a season ago.

AD_OpposedDenounce_9.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_9.text: But when Halsin departed... the shadows truly took root.

AD_OpposedDenounce_3.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_3.text: I should have resisted. It should have... been different.

AD_OpposedDenounce_2.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedDenounce_2.text: I was blind not to see it. Too trusting. A fool.
AD_OpposedDenounce_2.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with himself rather than her.

AD_OpposedDenounce_6.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_6.text: Not a fool. A friend. Would that I'd realised it...

AD_OpposedDenounce_8.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_8.text: I see it on your face. You hate me. And I don't blame you.

AD_OpposedDenounce_0.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedDenounce_0.text: I do not hate you. I am ashamed at how far I let your machinations spread.
AD_OpposedDenounce_0.context: NodeContext: A bit exasperated, but honest, genuine.

AD_OpposedDenounce_10.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedDenounce_10.context: NodeContext: An edge of anger in his voice. He was betrayed and is sorting through it.

AD_OpposedDenounce_7.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_7.text: If it's an argument you seek, you won't find it here.

AD_OpposedDenounce_5.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce_5.text: Whatever the Treefather's judgement, I will accept it in full.

KidFreed_0.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_0.text: I can't believe she's gone. I can't believe they'd do this to us!

KidFreed_4.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_4.text: Not now, I have to get back!

KidFreed_6.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_6.text: Ugh. I'm never gonna hear the end of this.

KidFreed_12.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_12.text: If I'd got that stupid idol, I'd be a hero.

KidFreed_5.speaker: Player
KidFreed_5.text: You were caught, and you could have been killed.

KidFreed_7.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_7.text: Least I tried. No one else was doing anything!

KidFreed_2.speaker: Player
KidFreed_2.text: What kind of hero did you expect to be?

KidFreed_13.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_13.text: A heroic thief! Mum, Dad, Mol - they all would've been so impressed.

KidFreed_3.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_3.text: Mol said we had to do something, because the old folks weren't doing anything.

KidFreed_10.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_10.text: They were talking when the druids were getting ready to throw us out.

KidFreed_1.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_1.text: Why can't we just stay until it's safe?

KidFreed_8.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_8.text: I can't believe he's gone. I can't believe they'd do this to us!

KidFreed_9.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_9.text: They're dead. What'll I do now...

KidFreed_14.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed_14.text: We're not gonna be safe. Not now, not ever.

AD_LeaderPersuaded_0.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_0.text: What have I done? Dearest Rath...

AD_LeaderPersuaded_1.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_1.text: Rath is... gone. Treefather forgive me, I acted a fool.

AD_LeaderPersuaded_3.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_3.text: Rath, may you find peace in the great silence.

AD_LeaderPersuaded_5.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_5.text: May they find peace in the great silence.

AD_LeaderPersuaded_6.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_6.text: How could I be so weak?

AD_LeaderPersuaded_4.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_4.text: Dearest Rath. You deserved so much better.

AD_LeaderPersuaded_7.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded_7.text: How could I...? Silvanus have mercy.
